elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: The final section of this survey asks questions about the last station of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey before {cvGenderSubjectPronoun} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge. If it's too painful to revisit this stage of {CmpnName}'s life, it might be best to discontinue the survey and return to it later.

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: This section references questions you asked earlier in the survey to get a picture of how {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP changed over time in relation to other factors that played a role in {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey.

elements.name: Conclusion
elements.html: The last survey section asks questions about the current state of {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP. By comparing your answers here to answers you provided earlier, we hope to get a picture of how {cvGenderObjectPronoun} condition changed over time and what factors may have played a role in the LP/GOLPP progression

elements.name: ConclusionIntro
elements.html: IMPORTANT: Please answer the questions about {CmpnName} in his current state of health:

elements.name: ConclusionSpecialConsiderations
elements.title: Please describe any special considerations for {CmpnName} due to LP-related breathing issues:

choices.text: Type, amount or frequency of feeding
Other behavior restrictions i.e., anxiety, excitement

elements.name: ConclusionQOL
elements.title: How would you rate {CmpnName}'s quality of life at this stage?

elements.name: ConclusionOtherConditions
elements.title: What other conditions {cvDoThirdPersonSingular} {CmpnName} have at this stage?
elements.description: Your selections here will be compared to earlier answers to deterimine which of these conditions developed during {CmpnName}'s LP/GOLPP journey.

elements.name: ConclusionCauseOfDeathHeading
elements.html: Euthanasia is a humane way to say goodbye when a beloved animal companion has reached end-of-life. This questions asks about the primary cause of {CmpnName}'s passing, not whether humane euthanasia was chosen to help them cross over.

elements.name: ConclusionCauseOfDeath
elements.title: What was the ultimate reason why {CmpnName} crossed over the Rainbow Bridge?

choices.text: Direct post-operative complications of LP surgery or stent implant

elements.name: ConclusionLastQuestionText
elements.html: LP/GOLPP is a merciless, ruthless disease that forces us to make impossible decisions for our beloved companions. The last question of this survey is speculative. If you were to have another dog with LP, would you choose a different path along their LP/GOLPP journey?

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathTieback
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do tieback surgery again
I would do tieback surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do tieback surgery longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathBVEAP
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would if anything you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do BVEAP surgery again
I would do BVEAP surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do BVEAP surgery longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathStent
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do the laryngeal stent implant again
I would do laryngeal stent implant surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do a laryngeal stent implant longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathArytenoidectomy
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do the arytenoidectomy surgery again
I would do the arytenoidectomy surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do the arytenoidectomy longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathVentrilocordectomy
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName} what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would not do the ventrilocordectomy surgery again
I would do the ventrilocordectomy surgery sooner than I did with {CmpnName}
I would wait to do the ventrilocordectomy longer than I did with {CmpnName}

elements.name: ConclusionOtherPathNoSurgery
elements.title: If you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP under similar circumstances as {CmpnName}, what if anything would you differently?

choices.text: I would pursue the same treatment path as with {CmpnName}
I would pursue tieback, laryngeal stent, or other veterinary procedure

elements.name: ConclusionStentAlternative
elements.title: If the laryngeal stent were widely available, would you pursue that as an alternative to surgery?

elements.name: ConclusionDifferentChoices
elements.title: Please briefly describe things you might do differently if you were to have another dog with LP/GOLPP (optional).
